channel.title: News and Upcoming Talks on Emily Sumner
channel.description: Recent content in News and Upcoming Talks on Emily Sumner

item.title: The Exploration Advantage- Children's instinct to explore allows them to detect information that adults miss only when the environment is changing
item.description: I will be presenting a poster at the 2019 Meeting of the Cognitive Development Society

item.title: Reproducible Developmental Science, Why and How
item.description: I will be leading a workshop on Bayesian statistics for developmental psychologists at this CogDev Preconference

item.title: Talk at UCSD Developmental Psychology Brown Bag
item.description: I will be giving a talk on exploration, decision making, and play as part of UCSD’s developmental psychology brownbag series.

item.title: Poster at CogSci2019
item.description: It’s not the treasure, it’s the hunt. Children are more explorative on an explore-exploit task than adults

item.title: Talk at the Society of Philosophy and Psychology
item.description: It’s not the treasure, it’s the hunt. Children are more explorative on an explore-exploit task than adults

item.title: Talk at SOCAL
item.description: I will be giving a talk on exploration during development at the Symposium on Cognitive and Language Development.

item.title: UCI Undergraduate Research Symposium 2019
item.description: My undergraduate research assistants presented their research at the UROP symposium.

item.title: 70 kids in 2 weeks!
item.description: My undergraduate research assistants and I collected data from 70 kids in two weeks, new lab record!

item.title: Public Impact Fellow
item.description: I recieved a Public Impact Fellowship.
